title: Part B-i
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:

title: Part B-iii
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide the complete chemical equation that represents the reaction between oceanic carbon dioxide and water, such as any of the following:

title: Part C-ii
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not identify an additional anthropogenic threat to the world’s coral reef ecosystem, such as any of the following:

· Increased ocean temperature

· Recreational activities, such as watercraft, scuba, snorkeling, swimming, etc.

· Fishing practices, such as bottom trawling, dynamite fishing, overfishing, etc.

· Nutrient pollution (from agricultural runoff, wastewater treatment plants, etc.)

· Sediment pollution (from logging operations, mining, etc.)

· Chemical pollution, such as oil spills, pesticide runoff, sunscreen, etc.

· Plastic/solid waste pollution

· Introduction of invasive species (lionfish/turkey fish, Philippine mantis shrimp, etc.)

The response identifies an additional anthropogenic threat to the world’s coral reef ecosystem, such as any of the following:

· Increased ocean temperature

· Recreational activities, such as watercraft, scuba, snorkeling, swimming, etc.

· Fishing practices, such as bottom trawling, dynamite fishing, overfishing, etc.

· Nutrient pollution (from agricultural runoff, wastewater treatment plants, etc.)

· Sediment pollution (from logging operations, mining, etc.)

· Chemical pollution, such as oil spills, pesticide runoff, sunscreen, etc.

· Plastic/solid waste pollution

· Introduction of invasive species (lionfish/turkey fish, Philippine mantis shrimp, etc.)

title: Part C-iii
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not describe how the additional anthropogenic threat damages the coral reefs and coral reef ecosystems, such as any of the following:

Increased ocean temperature

· Coral bleaching (loss of the algal symbiont)

· Reduction of dissolved oxygen concentration

Recreational activities, such as watercraft, scuba, snorkeling, swimming, etc.

· Physical damage to/destruction of coral reefs

Fishing practices, such as bottom trawling, dynamite fishing, overfishing, etc.

· Physical damage to/destruction of coral reefs

· Removal of key species disrupts the food web/causes a trophic cascade

Nutrient pollution (from agricultural runoff, wastewater treatment plants, etc.)

· Cultural eutrophication and eventual decrease in dissolved oxygen levels

· Excessive algal growth reduces light penetration

Sediment pollution (from logging operations, mining, etc.)

· Increased turbidity/reduction in light penetration

· Deposited sediments cover/smother coral reefs

Chemical pollution, such as oil spills, pesticide runoff, sunscreen, etc.

· Disruption of reproduction and growth cycles

· Disruption of metabolic processes

· Endocrine disruption/ DNA MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaqGebGaaeOtaiaabgeaaaa@3872@ damage

· Reduction in light penetration

Plastic/solid waste pollution

· Physical damage to/destruction of members of the coral reef ecosystem

· Reduction of light penetration

Introduction of invasive species (lionfish/turkey fish, Philippine mantis shrimp, etc.)

· Invasive species can outcompete native species
